sentences.english: I couldn't do anything other than reward him by walking on the more difficult side of the puddle.
sentences.chinese: 我帮不上什么忙，除了走泥坑更难走的一边来奖励他。

sentences.english: The pup was in a fix when he walked into the mudhole.
sentences.chinese: 小狗跌进泥坑便爬不出来了。

sentences.english: You can pick a banana out of a mud pit, open it up, and eat it.
sentences.chinese: 你甚至可以从泥坑里把香蕉拿出来就吃。

sentences.english: Narrator: Peppa and George love jumping in muddy puddles.
sentences.chinese: 佩奇和乔治喜欢在泥坑里跳。

sentences.english: The rain mired the cart and it couldn't be moved.
sentences.chinese: 下雨使马车陷入泥坑而无法前进。

sentences.english: Yet thou shalt plunge me in filth, and my garments shall abhor me.
sentences.chinese: 你却把我浸在泥坑内，甚至我的衣服都憎恶我。

sentences.english: Using all their strength, they pushed the cart out of the mud.
sentences.chinese: 大家用死劲儿才把车子推出泥坑。

sentences.english: "Go out and jump in the mud puddle, " he would tell the girls.
sentences.chinese: 出去，到泥坑里嬉戏吧，“他会这样告诉女儿。”

sentences.english: Mummy: Peppa. If you jump in muddy puddles, you must wear your boots.
sentences.chinese: 佩奇，如果你在泥坑里跳你必须穿上靴子。

definition: four legs facing the sky (idiom); flat on one's back
Shenkeng township in New Taipei City 新北市[Xin1 bei3 shi4], Taiwan
